comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content:
I suspect "Delia Torre" is actually the surname "Della Torre"--none of the other first names are included, and in the original caption it looks more like two Ls to me.   Assuming that, the woman so labeled is likely Gertrude Della Torre of the Westside Tennis Club--she won the tennis tournament at Morristown in 1914.  (NYTimes, 9 September 1914).

I only see six women, but seven names, and three of those are Hamilton.

comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: If you look at the full size, there are seven women in the picture -- you  can only see the head/hat of Miss DellaTorre (if the caption has them in the right order).

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Oh, you're right rjones0856!  Good reminder to look at the "big picture." ;)

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
pennylrichardsca:

Nice catch! It does look like she should be identified as Gertrude Della Torre. Thank you for the additional information and the source. We'll add to the record when we update.
